course1-4.des: indefinite articles, corresponding to 'a' or 'an' in English.

course1-4.en: I want to buy [[an]] ice cream.
I would like [[a]] bottle of water.
The station [[is]] near the city center.

course1-4.des: Using 'è' to talk about the weather.
Using 'sono' to describe a state after an activity.

course1.en: I go to school [[and]] I study.

course1.phrase: Lui è gentile [[a]] un po’ timido.
course1.pr: loo-ee eh jen-tee-leh [[ah]] oon poh tee-mee-doh
course1.en: He is kind but a bit shy.
course1.des: 'a' used to contrast two qualities, similar to 'but'.

course1.phrase: Amo la pizza [[ma]] non mangio carne.
course1.pr: ah-moh lah peet-tsah [[mah]] non mahn-joh kar-neh
course1.en: I love pizza but I don’t eat meat.
I study Italian [[because]] I like it.
I go out [[even though]] it's cold.

course1.phrase: Mangio la pizza [[anche se]] sono a dieta.
course1.pr: mahn-joh lah peet-tsah [[ahn-keh seh]] soh-no ah dyeh-tah
course1.en: I eat pizza [[even though]] I'm on a diet.

course1.phrase: Mi piace il gelato, [[ma]] preferisco la frutta.
course1.pr: mee pyah-cheh eel jeh-lah-toh, [[mah]] preh-feh-rees-koh lah froot-tah
course1.en: I like ice cream, but I prefer fruit.
Shall we go to the sea [[or]] the mountains?

course1.phrase: Leggo il libro [[anche se]] è noioso.
course1.en: I read the book [[even though]] it's boring.

course1-2.des: The preposition 'a' means 'to' and is used before places.
'Di' expresses origin or possession, here meaning 'from'.
'In' means 'in' and is used before countries and regions.

course1-2.en: The cat is under the bed.

course1-2.des: 'Dopo' means 'after' and is used for time.

course1-3.en: I want a coffee [[and]] a croissant.

course1-3.phrase: Mi piace il gelato, [[ma]] fa freddo.
course1-3.pr: mee PYA-cheh eel jeh-LAH-toh, [[mah]] fah FREHD-doh
course1-3.en: I like ice cream, but it’s cold.
I’m not going to the park [[because]] it’s raining.
[[If]] you want, we can study together.

course1-3.phrase: Mi piace il caffè [[e]] il tè.
course1-3.pr: mee pyah-cheh eel kah-feh [[eh]] eel teh

course1-3.en: I’m going to the park [[but it’s raining.
Do you prefer ice cream [[or]] cake?

course1-3.phrase: Studio italiano [[perché]] mi piace la lingua.
course1-3.pr: stoo-dee-oh ee-tah-lyah-no [[pehr-keh]] mee pyah-cheh lah leen-gwah
course1-3.en: I study Italian [[because]] I like the language.
Although it's late, we're going out.

course2.des: 'in' used for being in a place or building.

course2.en: The book is on the table.
I put the cup [[on]] the plate.
I go to the cinema with Maria.

course2.des: 'da' shows possession or being at someone's place.

course2.phrase: Ho bisogno di una penna [[per]] scrivere.
course2.pr: oh bee-zoh-nyoh dee oo-nah pen-nah [[pehr]] skree-veh-reh

course2.des: 'di' or 'su' used for 'about' depending on context (like 'о').

course3.des: 'Non' is the Italian equivalent of 'не' for negation.

course3.en: [[I am also]] going to the market.
I [[always]] go to work at eight.

introduction.phrase: Ciao! Mi chiamo Luca. E tu?
introduction.pr: ˈtʃao! mi ˈkjamo ˈluka. e tu?
introduction.en: Hi! My name is Luca. And you?

introduction.phrase: Ciao, Luca! Io sono Marco. Piacere di conoscerti!
introduction.pr: ˈtʃao, ˈluka! ˈio ˈsono ˈmarko. pjaˈtʃɛre di koˈnoʃʃerti!
introduction.en: Hi, Luca! I am Marco. Nice to meet you!
Nice to meet you, Marco! Where are you from?
I am from Rome. And you?

introduction.phrase: Sì, sono in vacanza con la mia famiglia.
introduction.pr: si, ˈsono in vaˈkantsa kon la ˈmia faˈmiʎʎa.
introduction.en: Yes, I am on vacation with my family.
Nice! How long are you staying?
I’m staying for a week. And you?

introduction.phrase: Io vivo qui, ma mi piace conoscere nuove persone!
introduction.pr: ˈio ˈvivo kwi, ma mi ˈpjatʃe koˈnoʃʃere ˈnwove perˈsone!
introduction.en: I live here, but I like meeting new people!

introduction.phrase: Fantastico! Magari possiamo prendere un caffè insieme.
introduction.pr: fanˈtastiko! maˈɡari posˈsamo ˈprɛndere un kafˈfɛ inˈsjɛme.
introduction.en: Fantastic! Maybe we can grab a coffee together.

introduction.phrase: Sì, volentieri! Conosci un buon bar qui vicino?
introduction.pr: si, volenˈtjɛri! koˈnoʃʃi un bwɔn bar kwi viˈtʃino?
introduction.en: Yes, I'd love to! Do you know a good café nearby?

introduction.phrase: Sì! C’è un bar molto carino a due passi da qui.
introduction.pr: si! tʃɛ un bar ˈmolto kaˈrino a ˈdue ˈpassi da kwi.
introduction.en: Yes! There's a very nice café just a short walk from here.

q/a.phrase: Mi piace la cultura italiana e voglio parlarlo meglio.
q/a.pr: mi ˈpjatʃe la kulˈtura itaˈljana e ˈvɔʎʎo parˈlarlo ˈmɛʎʎo.
q/a.en: I like Italian culture, and I want to speak it better.
How long have you been studying Italian?
I have been studying Italian for six months.

q/a.phrase: Sì, parlo inglese e un po’ di spagnolo.
q/a.pr: si, ˈparlo iŋˈɡleze e un po di spaˈɲolo.
q/a.en: Yes, I speak English and a little Spanish.

q/a2.phrase: Alcune cose sono facili, altre un po’ difficili.
q/a2.pr: alˈkune ˈkoze ˈsono ˈfatʃili, ˈaltre un po difˈfitʃili.
q/a2.en: Some things are easy, others a bit difficult.
Have you ever been to Italy?

q/a2.phrase: Sì, sono stato a Roma e Firenze.
q/a2.pr: si, ˈsono ˈstato a ˈroma e fiˈrɛntse.
q/a2.en: Yes, I have been to Rome and Florence.

q/a2.phrase: Qual è la tua parola italiana preferita?
q/a2.pr: kwal ɛ la ˈtwa paˈrola itaˈljana prefeˈrita?
q/a2.en: What is your favorite Italian word?

q/a3.en: Do you understand well when we speak fast?

q/a3.phrase: A volte sì, ma dipende dalla persona.
q/a3.pr: a ˈvolte si, ma diˈpɛnde dalla perˈsona.
q/a3.en: Sometimes yes, but it depends on the person.

q/a3.phrase: Cosa ti piace della lingua italiana?
q/a3.pr: ˈkɔza ti ˈpjatʃe della ˈliŋɡwa itaˈljana?
q/a3.en: What do you like about the Italian language?

q/a3.phrase: Mi piace il suono e la musicalità.
q/a3.pr: mi ˈpjatʃe il ˈswɔno e la muziˈkalita.
q/a3.en: I like the sound and musicality.

q/a3.phrase: Mi interessa il napoletano, ma è difficile!
q/a3.pr: mi interˈessa il napoleˈtano, ma ɛ difˈfitʃile!
q/a3.en: I’m interested in Neapolitan, but it’s difficult!
Would you like to live in Italy?
Yes, it would be a dream!

useful.en: I want to go to Italy.
I want to travel to Rome.
How do you say this?
How is this correctly pronounced?
How do I order? (in a restaurant)
Where do I order? (in a restaurant)

useful.phrase: Qual è il ristorante consigliato per mangiare qui?
useful.pr: kwal EH eel ree-stoh-RAHN-teh con-see-LYAH-toh per man-JAH-reh kwee?
useful.en: What is the recommended place/restaurant to eat here?
What is recommended to visit here?
What are you doing right now?
Are you busy?
Learning Italian is difficult.

useful.phrase: Sono ancora a un livello principiante in italiano.
useful.pr: SOH-noh an-KOH-rah ah oon lee-VEHL-loh prin-chee-pee-AHN-teh een ee-tah-LYAH-no
useful.en: I am still a beginner level in Italian.
Can you teach me a new word?
Can you speak English?
I like your accent.
Do you speak any other languages?

useful.phrase: Il tuo inglese è meglio del mio italiano.
useful.pr: eel TOO-oh een-GLAY-seh eh MEL-yoh del MEE-oh ee-tah-LYAH-no
useful.en: Your English speaking is better than my Italian speaking.
That’s cool/awesome!
Your pronunciation is good/great.

useful.phrase: Sto imparando la lingua perché suona bene.
useful.pr: stoh eem-pah-RAHN-doh lah LEEN-gwah pehr-KEH SWOH-nah BEH-neh
useful.en: I am learning the language because it sounds cool.

useful.phrase: Sto imparando la lingua perché è divertente parlarla.
useful.pr: stoh eem-pah-RAHN-doh lah LEEN-gwah pehr-KEH eh dee-vehr-TEN-teh par-LAR-lah
useful.en: I am learning the language because it's fun to speak.
Is this the line? (in a store)
Where is the line? (in a store)
What is that over there?

useful.phrase: Quale città dovrei visitare in Italia?
useful.pr: KWAH-leh chee-TAH doh-VRAY vee-zee-TAH-reh een ee-TAH-lya?
useful.en: What city should I visit in Italy?

useful.phrase: Voglio andare in Italia in futuro.
useful.pr: VOH-lyoh an-DAH-reh een ee-TAH-lya een foo-TOO-roh
useful.en: I want to go to Italy in the future.

useful.phrase: C’è una serie TV o un film italiano che consigli?
useful.pr: cheh OO-nah SEH-ryeh tee-VOO oh oon feelm ee-tah-LYAH-no keh con-SEEL-yee?
useful.en: Is there a specific TV show or movie that you recommend?

intro.des: Informal greeting and present tense of 'essere'.

intro.phrase: Sì, sono di Roma. E tu?
intro.pr: See, so-no dee Ro-ma. Eh too?
intro.en: Yes, I'm from Rome. And you?
intro.des: Present tense of 'essere' and 'di' to show origin.

intro.en: I'm American. My name is Marco.
intro.des: 'Mi chiamo' = My name is, reflexive verb.

intro.phrase: Piacere, Marco! Io mi chiamo Luca.
intro.pr: Pya-che-re, Mar-co! Ee-oh mee kyah-mo Loo-ka.
intro.en: Nice to meet you, Marco! My name is Luca.
intro.des: 'Piacere' is a common way to say 'Nice to meet you'.

intro.en: Thanks! I've been studying for three months.

intro.des: 'Ti piace' is used to ask about preferences.

intro.phrase: Sì, mi piace molto! Il cibo è fantastico.
intro.pr: See, mee pya-cheh mol-to! Eel chee-bo eh fan-tas-tee-co.
intro.en: Yes, I like it a lot! The food is fantastic.
Have you already visited other cities?

intro.phrase: Sì, sono stato a Firenze e Venezia.
intro.pr: See, so-no stah-to a Fee-ren-tseh eh Veh-ne-tsya.
intro.en: Yes, I've been to Florence and Venice.
intro.des: Use of 'essere' in passato prossimo for movement verbs.

asking-directions.speaker: Turista
asking-directions.en: Excuse me, where is the station?

asking-directions.speaker: Passante
asking-directions.phrase: La stazione è vicino. Vai sempre dritto e poi gira a sinistra.
asking-directions.pr: Lah stah-tsyo-neh eh vee-chee-no. Vai sem-preh dreet-toh eh poi jee-rah ah seen-eest-rah.
asking-directions.en: The station is nearby. Go straight ahead and then turn left.

asking-directions.speaker: Turista
asking-directions.phrase: Grazie mille! È lontano a piedi?
asking-directions.pr: Grah-tsyeh meel-leh! Eh lon-tah-no ah pyay-dee?
asking-directions.en: Thank you very much! Is it far on foot?

asking-directions.speaker: Passante
asking-directions.phrase: No, solo cinque minuti a piedi.
asking-directions.pr: Noh, soh-loh cheen-kweh mee-noo-tee ah pyay-dee.
asking-directions.en: No, just five minutes on foot.

story.phrase: Ciao! Sono molto bene, grazie. E tu?
story.pr: chow! soh-noh mol-toh beh-neh, grah-tsyeh. eh too?
story.en: Hi! I am very well, thank you. And you?

story.phrase: Anch’io sto bene, ma oggi sono un po’ stanco.
story.pr: an-kee-oh stoh beh-neh, mah ohj-jee soh-noh oon poh stan-koh
story.en: I am fine too, but today I am a bit tired.
story.des: Mixing 'sono' for self-description and 'ma' (but) as a connector.

story.phrase: Sono a Roma, vicino al Colosseo.
story.pr: soh-noh ah roh-mah, vee-chee-no ahl koh-loh-seh-oh
story.en: I am in Rome, near the Colosseum.
How is Rome at this time of year?
story.des: Using 'è' to ask about a place.

story.phrase: È bellissima! Ci sono molti turisti.
story.pr: eh bel-lees-see-mah! chee soh-noh mol-tee too-ree-stee
story.en: It is beautiful! There are many tourists.
story.des: Using 'è' for description and 'ci sono' for existence.
Using 'è' to ask about the weather.

story.en: It is very sunny and warm.

story.phrase: Devo andare, ma è stato bello parlare con te.
story.pr: deh-voh an-dah-reh, mah eh stah-toh bel-loh par-lah-reh kon teh
story.en: I have to go, but it was nice talking to you.
story.des: Using 'è stato' (it was) in a polite farewell.

masculine/plural-nouns2.phrase: I ristoranti in città sono economici.
masculine/plural-nouns2.pr: ee rees-toh-rahn-tee een cheet-tah soh-noh eh-koh-noh-mee-chee
masculine/plural-nouns2.en: The restaurants in the city are cheap.
masculine/plural-nouns2.des: Describing restaurants using location and price.

masculine/plural-nouns2.phrase: I ponti sul fiume sono antichi.
masculine/plural-nouns2.pr: ee pohn-tee sool fyoo-meh soh-noh an-tee-kee
masculine/plural-nouns2.en: The bridges on the river are ancient.

masculine/plural-nouns2.phrase: I parchi vicino alle scuole sono tranquilli.
masculine/plural-nouns2.pr: ee par-kee vee-chee-noh ahl-leh skwoh-leh soh-noh trahn-kwee-lee
masculine/plural-nouns2.en: The parks near the schools are quiet.
masculine/plural-nouns2.des: Describing parks with location and atmosphere.

masculine/plural-nouns2.phrase: I mercati sono vivaci ma affollati.
masculine/plural-nouns2.pr: ee mer-kah-tee soh-noh vee-vah-chee mah aff-oh-lah-tee
masculine/plural-nouns2.en: The markets are lively but crowded.

masculine/plural-nouns2.phrase: I treni verso Milano sono puntuali.
masculine/plural-nouns2.pr: ee treh-nee vehr-soh mee-lah-noh soh-noh poon-too-ah-lee
masculine/plural-nouns2.en: The trains to Milan are on time.

masculine/plural-nouns2.phrase: I negozi nel centro sono aperti fino a tardi.
masculine/plural-nouns2.pr: ee neh-goht-tsee nel chen-troh soh-noh ah-pehr-tee fee-noh ah tar-dee
masculine/plural-nouns2.en: The shops in the center are open until late.
masculine/plural-nouns2.phrase_name: Shops in the center open late

masculine/plural-nouns2.phrase: I villaggi tra le montagne sono pittoreschi.
masculine/plural-nouns2.pr: ee veel-lahj-jee trah leh mon-tahn-yeh soh-noh pee-tor-res-kee
masculine/plural-nouns2.en: The villages among the mountains are picturesque.

masculine/plural-nouns2.phrase: I teatri con spettacoli serali sono famosi.
masculine/plural-nouns2.pr: ee teh-ah-tree kon speht-tah-koh-lee seh-rah-lee soh-noh fah-moh-see
masculine/plural-nouns2.en: The theaters with evening shows are famous.

masculine/plural-nouns2.phrase: I corsi di lingua sono utili per il lavoro.
masculine/plural-nouns2.pr: ee kor-see dee leen-gwah soh-noh oo-tee-lee pehr eel lah-voh-roh
masculine/plural-nouns2.en: The language courses are useful for work.
masculine/plural-nouns2.des: Talking about courses and their purpose.

masculine/plural-nouns2.phrase: I vicoli tra le case vecchie sono stretti.
masculine/plural-nouns2.pr: ee vee-koh-lee trah leh kah-seh vek-kee-eh soh-noh streht-tee
masculine/plural-nouns2.en: The alleys between the old houses are narrow.

masculine/plural-nouns2.phrase: I documenti sulla scrivania sono importanti.
masculine/plural-nouns2.pr: ee doh-koo-men-tee sool-lah skree-vah-nee-ah soh-noh eem-por-tahn-tee
masculine/plural-nouns2.en: The documents on the desk are important.

masculine/plural-nouns2.phrase: I voli per Roma sono frequenti.
masculine/plural-nouns2.pr: ee voh-lee pehr roh-mah soh-noh freh-kwen-tee
masculine/plural-nouns2.en: The flights to Rome are frequent.

masculine/plural-nouns2.phrase: I turisti con guide locali imparano di più.
masculine/plural-nouns2.pr: ee too-ree-stee kon gwee-deh loh-kah-lee eem-pah-rah-noh dee pyoo
masculine/plural-nouns2.en: Tourists with local guides learn more.
masculine/plural-nouns2.phrase_name: Tourists learn more with local guides

masculine/plural-nouns2.phrase: I lavori senza strumenti sono difficili.
masculine/plural-nouns2.pr: ee lah-voh-ree sen-zah stroo-men-tee soh-noh dee-fee-chee-lee

masculine/plural-nouns3.phrase: I ristoranti in città sono economici.
masculine/plural-nouns3.pr: ee rees-toh-rahn-tee een cheet-tah soh-noh eh-koh-noh-mee-chee
masculine/plural-nouns3.en: The restaurants in the city are cheap.
masculine/plural-nouns3.des: Describing restaurants using location and price.

masculine/plural-nouns3.phrase: I ponti sul fiume sono antichi.
masculine/plural-nouns3.pr: ee pohn-tee sool fyoo-meh soh-noh an-tee-kee
masculine/plural-nouns3.en: The bridges on the river are ancient.

masculine/plural-nouns3.phrase: I parchi vicino alle scuole sono tranquilli.
masculine/plural-nouns3.pr: ee par-kee vee-chee-noh ahl-leh skwoh-leh soh-noh trahn-kwee-lee
masculine/plural-nouns3.en: The parks near the schools are quiet.
masculine/plural-nouns3.des: Describing parks with location and atmosphere.

masculine/plural-nouns3.phrase: I mercati sono vivaci ma affollati.
masculine/plural-nouns3.pr: ee mer-kah-tee soh-noh vee-vah-chee mah aff-oh-lah-tee
masculine/plural-nouns3.en: The markets are lively but crowded.

masculine/plural-nouns3.phrase: I treni verso Milano sono puntuali.
masculine/plural-nouns3.pr: ee treh-nee vehr-soh mee-lah-noh soh-noh poon-too-ah-lee
masculine/plural-nouns3.en: The trains to Milan are on time.

masculine/plural-nouns3.phrase: I negozi nel centro sono aperti fino a tardi.
masculine/plural-nouns3.pr: ee neh-goht-tsee nel chen-troh soh-noh ah-pehr-tee fee-noh ah tar-dee
masculine/plural-nouns3.en: The shops in the center are open until late.
masculine/plural-nouns3.phrase_name: Shops in the center open late

masculine/plural-nouns3.phrase: I villaggi tra le montagne sono pittoreschi.
masculine/plural-nouns3.pr: ee veel-lahj-jee trah leh mon-tahn-yeh soh-noh pee-tor-res-kee
masculine/plural-nouns3.en: The villages among the mountains are picturesque.

masculine/plural-nouns3.phrase: I teatri con spettacoli serali sono famosi.
masculine/plural-nouns3.pr: ee teh-ah-tree kon speht-tah-koh-lee seh-rah-lee soh-noh fah-moh-see
masculine/plural-nouns3.en: The theaters with evening shows are famous.

masculine/plural-nouns3.phrase: I corsi di lingua sono utili per il lavoro.
masculine/plural-nouns3.pr: ee kor-see dee leen-gwah soh-noh oo-tee-lee pehr eel lah-voh-roh
masculine/plural-nouns3.en: The language courses are useful for work.
masculine/plural-nouns3.des: Talking about courses and their purpose.

masculine/plural-nouns3.phrase: I vicoli tra le case vecchie sono stretti.
masculine/plural-nouns3.pr: ee vee-koh-lee trah leh kah-seh vek-kee-eh soh-noh streht-tee
masculine/plural-nouns3.en: The alleys between the old houses are narrow.

masculine/plural-nouns3.phrase: I documenti sulla scrivania sono importanti.
masculine/plural-nouns3.pr: ee doh-koo-men-tee sool-lah skree-vah-nee-ah soh-noh eem-por-tahn-tee
masculine/plural-nouns3.en: The documents on the desk are important.

masculine/plural-nouns3.phrase: I voli per Roma sono frequenti.
masculine/plural-nouns3.pr: ee voh-lee pehr roh-mah soh-noh freh-kwen-tee
masculine/plural-nouns3.en: The flights to Rome are frequent.

masculine/plural-nouns3.phrase: I turisti con guide locali imparano di più.
masculine/plural-nouns3.pr: ee too-ree-stee kon gwee-deh loh-kah-lee eem-pah-rah-noh dee pyoo
masculine/plural-nouns3.en: Tourists with local guides learn more.
masculine/plural-nouns3.phrase_name: Tourists learn more with local guides

masculine/plural-nouns3.phrase: I lavori senza strumenti sono difficili.
masculine/plural-nouns3.pr: ee lah-voh-ree sen-zah stroo-men-tee soh-noh dee-fee-chee-lee

masculine/singular-nouns.phrase: Il ristorante vicino alla stazione è famoso.
masculine/singular-nouns.pr: eel rees-toh-rahn-teh vee-chee-noh ahl-lah stah-tsyoh-neh eh fah-moh-soh
masculine/singular-nouns.en: The restaurant near the station is famous.

masculine/singular-nouns.phrase: Il ponte sul fiume è molto antico.
masculine/singular-nouns.pr: eel pohn-teh sool fyoo-meh eh mol-toh an-tee-koh
masculine/singular-nouns.en: The bridge over the river is very old.
masculine/singular-nouns.des: Talking about a landmark and its age.

masculine/singular-nouns.phrase: Il parco in centro è tranquillo.
masculine/singular-nouns.pr: eel par-koh een chen-troh eh trahn-kwee-loh
masculine/singular-nouns.en: The park in the center is quiet.
masculine/singular-nouns.des: Describing a park’s location and atmosphere.

masculine/singular-nouns.phrase: Il mercato è vivace ma piccolo.
masculine/singular-nouns.pr: eel mer-kah-toh eh vee-vah-cheh mah pee-koh-loh
masculine/singular-nouns.en: The market is lively but small.
masculine/singular-nouns.des: Contrasting two characteristics of a market.

masculine/singular-nouns.phrase: Il treno per Milano è puntuale.
masculine/singular-nouns.pr: eel treh-noh pehr mee-lah-noh eh poon-too-ah-leh
masculine/singular-nouns.en: The train to Milan is on time.

masculine/singular-nouns.phrase: Il negozio all’angolo è aperto fino a tardi.
masculine/singular-nouns.pr: eel neh-goht-tzyoh ahl-lahn-goh-loh eh ah-pehr-toh fee-noh ah tar-dee
masculine/singular-nouns.en: The shop on the corner is open until late.
masculine/singular-nouns.phrase_name: Shop on the corner open late

masculine/singular-nouns.phrase: Il villaggio tra le montagne è pittoresco.
masculine/singular-nouns.pr: eel veel-lahj-joh trah leh mon-tahn-yeh eh pee-tor-res-koh
masculine/singular-nouns.en: The village between the mountains is picturesque.

masculine/singular-nouns.phrase: Il teatro con spettacoli serali è famoso.
masculine/singular-nouns.pr: eel teh-ah-troh kon speht-tah-koh-lee seh-rah-lee eh fah-moh-soh
masculine/singular-nouns.en: The theater with evening shows is famous.

masculine/singular-nouns.phrase: Il corso di lingua è utile per il lavoro.
masculine/singular-nouns.pr: eel kor-soh dee leen-gwah eh oo-tee-leh pehr eel lah-voh-roh
masculine/singular-nouns.en: The language course is useful for work.
masculine/singular-nouns.des: Talking about a course and its benefit.
Talking about a concert and its cost.

masculine/singular-nouns.phrase: Il vicolo dietro la chiesa è stretto.
masculine/singular-nouns.pr: eel vee-koh-loh dyeh-troh lah kyeh-sah eh stret-toh
masculine/singular-nouns.en: The alley behind the church is narrow.
masculine/singular-nouns.des: Describing a street’s location and size.

masculine/singular-nouns.phrase: Il documento sulla scrivania è importante.
masculine/singular-nouns.pr: eel doh-koo-men-toh sool-lah skree-vah-nee-ah eh eem-por-tahn-teh
masculine/singular-nouns.en: The document on the desk is important.
masculine/singular-nouns.des: Talking about a document and its location.

masculine/singular-nouns.phrase: Il volo per Roma è frequente.
masculine/singular-nouns.pr: eel voh-loh pehr roh-mah eh freh-kwen-teh
masculine/singular-nouns.en: The flight to Rome is frequent.

masculine/singular-nouns.phrase: Il turista con la guida locale impara molto.
masculine/singular-nouns.pr: eel too-ree-stah kon lah gwee-dah loh-kah-leh eem-pah-rah mol-toh
masculine/singular-nouns.en: The tourist with the local guide learns a lot.
masculine/singular-nouns.des: Talking about learning experiences for tourists.

masculine/singular-nouns.phrase: Il lavoro senza strumenti è difficile.
masculine/singular-nouns.pr: eel lah-voh-roh sen-zah stroo-men-tee eh dee-fee-chee-leh
masculine/singular-nouns.en: The job without tools is difficult.

masculine/singular-nouns2.en: The boy buys an ice cream.

masculine/singular-nouns2.pr: eel bahm-bee-noh joh-kah kon lah pahl-lah
masculine/singular-nouns2.en: The child plays with the ball.
The customer waits at the counter.
masculine/singular-nouns2.des: Talking about waiting in a shop.

masculine/singular-nouns2.en: The father works in an office.
The brother studies in the library.

masculine/singular-nouns2.pr: eel klee-en-teh pah-gah kon lah kar-tah
masculine/singular-nouns2.en: The customer pays with a card.

phrases1.en: I’d like to pay by card.

phrases1.phrase: Qual è la specialità della casa?
phrases1.pr: kwal e la spe-tsya-li-ta del-la ka-sa

phrases1.phrase: Un biglietto di andata e ritorno.
phrases1.pr: un bi-lyet-to di an-da-ta e ri-tor-no

phrases1.phrase: A che ora parte il treno?
phrases1.pr: a ke o-ra par-te il tre-no
phrases1.en: What time does the train leave?
Does this train stop in Rome?

phrases1.phrase: C’è un autobus per il centro?
phrases1.pr: che un ow-to-bus per il chen-tro
phrases1.en: Is there a bus to downtown?
Where can I rent a car?

phrases1.phrase: È disponibile in un altro colore?
phrases1.pr: e dis-po-ni-bi-le in un al-tro ko-lo-re
phrases1.en: Is it available in another color?
I’d like to pay in cash.
Can you give me a discount?

phrases2.en: What are you up to today?

phrases2.phrase: Hai fatto qualcosa di interessante questo weekend?
phrases2.pr: ai fat-to kwal-ko-sa di in-ter-ess-an-te kwes-to wee-kend
phrases2.en: Did you do anything interesting this weekend?

phrases2.pr: si, so-no an-da-to/ a al ma-re
phrases2.en: Yes, I went to the beach.

phrases2.phrase: Che bello! Io sono rimasto/a a casa.
phrases2.pr: ke bel-lo! io so-no ri-ma-sto/ a a ka-sa

phrases2.en: Do you like the weather today?
Did you see the latest movie?
No, not yet. Is it good?
What kind of music do you like?

phrases2.phrase: Sì, mi piace leggere e cucinare.
phrases2.pr: si, mi pya-che led-ge-re e ku-ci-na-re
phrases2.en: Yes, I like reading and cooking.
What do you do for work?
Yes, I like it a lot.
Do you have brothers or sisters?

phrases2.phrase: Ho un fratello e una sorella.
phrases2.pr: o un fra-tel-lo e u-na so-rel-la
phrases2.en: I have a brother and a sister.
Yes, I love visiting new places.

phrases2.phrase: Mi piace la pasta e la pizza.
phrases2.pr: mi pya-che la pas-ta e la pit-za

phrases2.phrase: Che tipo di film ti piacciono?
phrases2.pr: ke ti-po di film ti pya-cho-no
phrases2.en: What type of movies do you like?

phrases2.phrase: Mi piacciono i film comici e d’azione.
phrases2.pr: mi pya-cho-no i film ko-mi-chi e da-tsyo-ne
phrases2.en: I like comedies and action movies.
Yes, I ran at the park.

phrases2.phrase: Sì, mi piace provare nuove ricette.
phrases2.pr: si, mi pya-che pro-va-re nuo-ve ri-chet-te
phrases2.en: Yes, I like trying new recipes.

phrases2.phrase: Che programmi hai per il weekend?
phrases2.pr: ke pro-gra-mi ai per il wee-kend
phrases2.en: What plans do you have for the weekend?

phrases2.phrase: Niente di speciale, forse una passeggiata.
phrases2.pr: nyen-te di spe-cha-le, for-se u-na pas-sej-ja-ta

phrases2.phrase: Hai visto qualche serie TV interessante?
phrases2.pr: ai vis-to kwal-ke se-ri-e TV in-ter-ess-an-te
phrases2.en: Have you seen any interesting TV series?

phrases2.phrase: Sì, ho visto una serie fantastica su Netflix.
phrases2.pr: si, o vis-to u-na se-ri-e fan-ta-sti-ca su Netflix
phrases2.en: Yes, I watched a fantastic series on Netflix.

phrases3.en: What do you do for work?
What do you do in your free time?

phrases3.phrase: Sì, ho un cane e un gatto.
phrases3.pr: si, o un ka-ne e un gat-to
phrases3.en: Yes, I have a dog and a cat.
What do you do on weekends?

phrases3.phrase: Mi piace uscire con gli amici.
phrases3.pr: mi pya-che u-sci-re kon gli a-mi-ci
phrases3.en: I like going out with friends.

phrases3.phrase: Io resto a casa e guardo film.
phrases3.pr: io res-to a ka-sa e guar-do film
phrases3.en: I stay home and watch movies.

phrases3.phrase: Hai visto qualche film di recente?
phrases3.pr: ai vis-to kwal-ke film di re-chen-te
phrases3.en: Have you seen any movies recently?

phrases3.phrase: Sì, ho visto un film interessante.
phrases3.pr: si, o vis-to un film in-ter-ess-an-te
phrases3.en: Yes, I watched an interesting movie.

phrases3.phrase: Qual è il tuo ristorante preferito?
phrases3.pr: kwal e il tuo re-sto-ran-te pre-fe-ri-to

phrases3.phrase: Mi piace il ristorante italiano vicino a casa.
phrases3.pr: mi pya-che il re-sto-ran-te i-ta-lia-no vi-ci-no a ka-sa
phrases3.en: I like the Italian restaurant near home.
Yes, I love trying new recipes.
What kind of music do you listen to?

phrases3.phrase: Mi piace il rock e il pop.
phrases3.pr: mi pya-che il rok e il pop

phrases3.phrase: Preferisci ascoltare musica o guardare film?
phrases3.pr: pre-fe-ris-ki as-col-ta-re mu-zi-ka o guar-da-re film
phrases3.en: Do you prefer listening to music or watching movies?
Do you like the weather today?
Have you read any interesting books?

phrases3.phrase: Sì, sto leggendo un romanzo giallo.
phrases3.pr: si, sto led-ge-ndo un ro-man-tso jial-lo
phrases3.en: Yes, I’m reading a mystery novel.

phrases3.phrase: Sì, gioco a calcio e nuoto.
phrases3.pr: si, gio-ko a kal-cho e nuo-to
phrases3.en: Yes, I play soccer and swim.
I prefer going to the gym.
What do you do after work?
Do you have plans for tonight?
Yes, I’m going to the cinema.

phrases3.phrase: No, resterò a casa a leggere.
phrases3.pr: no, re-ste-ro a ka-sa a led-ge-re
phrases3.en: No, I’ll stay home and read.
Yes, I speak English and French.

phrases3.phrase: È stato bello parlare con te.
phrases3.pr: e sta-to bel-lo par-la-re kon te
phrases3.en: It was nice talking to you.

part1.en: I do [[not]] want to go out.

part1.des: Used to express lack of understanding.

part1.pr: Io va-do al chi-ne-ma, an-ke Lu-ca.
part1.en: I go to the cinema, [[and]] Luca too.

part1.phrase: Mi piace il gelato, [[anche a]] te.
part1.pr: Mi pia-ce il ge-la-to, an-ke a te.
part1.en: I like ice cream, [[and]] you too.

part1.des: Asks if an action is completed.

part1.en: I [[always]] go to school on foot.

part1.des: Indicates a specific object close by.
Used to point out an item.

part1.phrase: Non sono andato a scuola [[perché]] ero malato.
part1.pr: Non so-no an-da-to a sco-la [[per-ke]] e-ro ma-la-to.
part1.en: I didn’t go to school [[because]] I was sick.
part1.des: Gives a reason for an action.

part1.en: He is crying [[because]] he is sad.

part1.phrase: Ho studiato molto [[così]] che potessi superare l’esame.
part1.pr: Ho stu-dia-to mol-to [[ko-zi]] ke po-tes-si su-pe-ra-re l’e-sa-me.
part1.en: I studied a lot [[so that]] I could pass the exam.

part1.phrase: Scrivo una lista [[così]] che non dimentichi nulla.
part1.pr: Scri-vo u-na li-sta [[ko-zi]] ke non di-men-ti-chi nul-la.
part1.en: I write a list [[so that]] I don’t forget anything.
I listen to music [[while]] I study.

part1.phrase: Lui cucina [[mentre]] io apparecchio la tavola.
part1.pr: Lui cu-ci-na [[men-tre]] io ap-pa-rec-chio la ta-vo-la.
part1.en: He cooks [[while]] I set the table.

part1.phrase: Ho finito i compiti, [[allora]] posso uscire.
part1.pr: Ho fi-ni-to i com-pi-ti, [[al-lo-ra]] pos-so u-sci-re.
part1.en: I finished my homework, [[then]] I can go out.
If you want to come, [[then]] let's go.

part1.phrase: Non ho soldi, [[quindi]] non posso comprare il libro.
part1.pr: Non ho sol-di, [[kwi-n-di]] non pos-so com-pra-re il li-bro.
part1.en: I have no money, [[therefore]] I cannot buy the book.

part1.phrase: Ha studiato molto, [[quindi]] ha superato l’esame.
part1.pr: Ha stu-dia-to mol-to, [[kwi-n-di]] ha su-pe-ra-to l’e-sa-me.
part1.en: He studied a lot, [[so]] he passed the exam.

part1.phrase: Mangio la pizza [[anche se]] non ho fame.
part1.pr: Man-gio la piz-za [[an-ke se]] non ho fa-me.
part1.en: I eat pizza [[although]] I’m not hungry.

part1.phrase: Io leggo [[mentre che]] lui guarda la TV.
part1.pr: Io le-ggo [[men-tre ke]] lui guar-da la TV.
